property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={66, 16, 1294, 712}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value:
This model presents a timed approach to a real-time accessor composition problem. (Please see MoC.xml for a pure dataflow approach).
Here, the host explicitly specifies the starting time of each verse clip using the "SingleEvent" actors. The director is synchronized to real time, so it will fire each SingleEvent actor at the specified time.
This model does not limit the length of inserted clips or handle any faults.
The song is "The Fox (What Does The Fox Say?) by Ylvis http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Fox_%28What_Does_the_Fox_Say%3F%29 The animal sounds are from SeaWorld: http://seaworld.org/en/animal-info/animal-sounds/

property.name: text
property.value: Verse start times are now specified.

property.name: text
property.value: Author: Elizabeth Latronico

property.name: text
property.value: This model requires audio files at: https://accessors.org/wiki/Main/WhatMoCs?

property.name: text
property.value: Please turn your speakers on :) Requires Java 1.8

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: An accessor for playing a sound clip.

property.name: author
property.value: Elizabeth Osyk (beth@berkeley.edu)

property.name: clipURL (parameter)
property.value: The URL to retrieve the sound clip from.

property.name: stop (port)
property.value: A trigger to stop playback. The value is ignored and can be anything.

property.name: start (port)
property.value: A trigger input to start playback. The value is ignored and can be anything.
